definition: abbr. for Guangzhou 廣州|广州[Guang3 zhou1]

sentences.english: Gleaning was allowed for the very poorest of the people.
sentences.chinese: 拾取麦穗是最穷的人所允许的。

sentences.english: The teacher asked him to go to a farmland to find a wheatear which is the biggest and the most golden.
sentences.chinese: 老师让他到麦田去，找一颗最大的最金黄的麦穗。

sentences.english: Thus the ear at the top of the stalk remained， just as it grows today.
sentences.chinese: 于是麦穗留了下来，就像现在生长的这样子。

sentences.english: Her right hand was picking up left-over wheat spikes, while a broken basket hang onto her left shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 右手拿着从田里拾取的麦穗，左臂上悬挂着一个破筐。

sentences.english: Foam to wheat, a glitter of seas.
sentences.chinese: 从泡沫到麦穗，众海之闪烁。

sentences.english: Blue sky, green trees, red sunsets and golden crops.
sentences.chinese: 蓝天，绿树，酒红色的夕阳以及金闪闪的麦穗。

sentences.english: So she went out and began to glean in the fields behind the harvesters.
sentences.chinese: 路得就去了，来到田间，在收割的人身后拾取麦穗。

sentences.english: Shang Qing wheat wheat kernel inside is the.
sentences.chinese: 尚青的麦穗里边是有麦仁了的。

sentences.english: The fishes infected were raised on balcony for experiment.
sentences.chinese: 感染后的麦穗鱼均在阳台上饲养待查。

sentences.english: In all countries God's people are being tried "like as corn is sifted in a sieve."
sentences.chinese: 在各邦，上帝的选民都要像麦穗经过打谷机。

sentences.english: This indicated a satisfactory practical value of this model in forecasting the occurrence of wheat aphids in the earing stage.
sentences.chinese: 证明该模型对预测小麦穗期蚜虫发生程度有较好效果。

sentences.english: If you find the most magnificent stalk, then you have found love.
sentences.chinese: 如果你摘到最大最好的麦穗，你就找到爱情了。

definition: ear of grain/gerbe (used on coats of arms)
to have the ears of grain come up
fruit (produced by a plant)/(fig.) fruits (of success etc)/results/gains
variant of 包穀|包谷[bao1 gu3]
